After all, it was your suggestion that allowed us to experience these precious moments together.

Title: Sunflower's Gift
Content:
Good afternoon, Commandant. How are you today?
When I sent you back, I wanted to give you this gift in person. However, after a second thought, I decided to include it in this mail instead, because I believe that written words have a more lasting impact than spoken ones.
I crafted this framed sunflower during my spare time. It reminded me of that day we watched the sunrise together on the beach and the poem I shared with you. In the poem, the sunflower yearns for sunshine, patiently waiting for the arrival of each sunrise, only to see the sun depart, making way for the sunset.
There was a time, long ago, when I was a traveling merchant. I, too, felt limited in what I could achieve, slowly growing while simply following the endless flow of mundane tasks...
However, after I came to Babylonia, you celebrated my activation date with me, and everyone took the opportunity to get acquainted little by little. Many things have started to change since then.

This year has been filled with many memories of our time together, and as a result, I found the future that I was looking forward to...
I'm deeply grateful for everything you did for me at that time. Thank you... thank you for having faith in me, regardless of what happened.
I remember every word you've said to me... and I will always cherish those moments.

Title: Good Afternoon, Commandant
Content: Good afternoon, Commandant. Today is my Activation Date.\nLucia has been preparing dinner since this morning, but don't worry. There are no missions today, so both Lee and I are here to help her. By the way, your meeting should be over by the evening, right? Lee just asked Celica to help you with the paperwork. You don't need to worry about things on our end, so please rest assured. We'll be waiting for you in the lounge, as usual.

Title: This Is Hippocrates...
Content:
Gray Raven Commandant, right? Here's your health check-up report from last month.
Liv was supposed to bring it back to you, but it seems she might have been delayed by something. After she finished writing her notes this morning, she left the report at the medical center. I tried calling her, but she didn't answer... I assume she is already with you by now.
She always meticulously checks your health reports multiple times, fearing that something might be overlooked. Then, she creates detailed plans, with categorized notes for different aspects. You should know best what kind of person she is. She never shows any signs of anxiety in front of me and always keeps things to herself...
Even on a day like today, her thoughts are not focused on herself. She must have prepared something for you and the other two members of Gray Raven. Well... that's just Liv for you.
So, please take good care of yourself. This is not medical advice from me as a doctor but a wish from Liv's heart.
Other than that, be sure to take her heart's desire and make it come true.

Title: About The Longevity Noodle Contest
Content: Commandant, long time no see! Guess what? There's this longevity noodle contest happening today on the Nighter. Apparently, the challenge is to make a 100-meter-long noodle. And you know what the prize is? The Kong Fu Bible I've been dying to get my hands on! I never expected the event host to have such a treasure. But here's the thing... making a 100-meter-long noodle all on my own might be quite tricky. That's where you come in, Commandant! You can take charge of the dough kneading, and I'll pull it into noodles. With our teamwork, victory is practically guaranteed!\nSo, how about we make a little bet? If you help me win the contest, I'll let you borrow the grand prize. Deal?\nWell then, I'll see you there, Commandant!

Title: This Codex Should Be Yours!
Content:
I never thought you would win on your own during the kneading stage...
But in the end, there were no extra rules to prevent you from winning the contest by forming those "100 meters" letters with flour...
Well, thank you for graciously giving the prize to me, but let's be real, you earned it fair and square with your own hard work. I'm happy to settle for a copy. The original should stay with the rightful winner!
In return, how about we celebrate my Activation Date together again next year? We can plan a more fun event with everyone!
Unfortunately, I only have one Activation Date every year, and it always feels like I can never find a good excuse at other times. Wait, I mean... it's not an excuse!
It's just that... who knows how long it'll be until we meet again... Oh, right! Now that you've got that secret codex of martial arts, we can train together!
Building physical strength is crucial for a commandant like you, isn't it? So, let's work on our inner power! May our journey lead us to the pinnacle of martial arts!
*If, by any chance, you dare to slack off and not come find me, I'll go all the way to Babylonia to check up on you.

Title: Regarding Hamlet
Content:
Hm... Is this Gray Raven Commandant?
I believe you're the only person apart from Selena who's used this Hamlet prototype, right? Ayla was bothering me a few days ago about "this time of the year again" as she went on and on about "friendship and bond" and how she wouldn't "give up on hope." She asked me to fix this prototype, and she said you were involved too... I have to manually configure 20000 sequences every time I turn it on! This is ridiculous.
Anyway, this thing showed up, and Ayla had her gunlance ready by the time I found it as she prepared to go to the surface.
Now... if you really "capture" Selena this time, lecture her on my behalf! Even if it's unlikely...
By the way, are you guys using me as a radio operator? Hamlet is not a radio, dammit...

Title: ▅█▁▃█▃...
Content:
Conductor, you should go see the pine forest up North in early fall.
Across cliffs and ranges, over the stormy sea, there is a pine forest—
When soil dried up back then, trees held hands with their companions...
Like lovers even as they fell.
They stayed together for centuries, eventually becoming coal.
Their scent smells of mud, trees, pinecones, and the morning dew.

As I lay on top of this burning land, Conductor, I can smell it.
The scent travels through villages in the morning, at noon, and in the evening.
Young children would jump around in the mist.
Sunlight glows sporadically amidst wheat, grains, and corn.
I see it, Conductor.
We can reap the sunlight with our sickles, piling them into small heaps and storing them in barns.
Leave these moments in the breeze in the homelands we left behind—
Every day, every month, every year... the sun will warm our hearts all the same.

Title: This Is Sophia
Content:
Good morning, Commandant.
I recently discovered that the mailbox has a voice input feature, which converts spoken words into text. It's... very convenient for me.
Just now, Jamilah told me that she's worked out a deal with you and wants me to meet her in Babylonia to discuss the details.
The reconstruction of Asslam has reached a critical stage, and Jamilah's decision to allow my departure means that she sees enough value in this deal.
When I asked for more information, she just said it'll be a surprise and didn't share anything else.
The transport craft to Babylonia is preparing for departure.
Could you please share more about the business?
This will help me consider what I should focus on during the journey.
...
Additionally, I have brought some cookies as a complimentary gift for our business discussion, free of charge.

Title: To Commandant
Content:
I struggle to find the right words to express myself, so I'll write them down in hopes that... you'll understand what I mean.
The business turned out to be a surprise for my Activation Date. You made a lot of preparations for me in Babylonia. Thank you, Commandant.
I'm very happy now, but not completely happy... It's not like I'm unhappy, but outside the happy feeling, there are some... (some words are crossed out) other feelings that are not unhappiness.
I'm sorry. I don't know how to say it clearly.
That feeling, I... (many words are crossed out)
I still can't quite put it into words.
Jamilah told me that when a merchant receives a gift, they should assess its true value in their mind and give something in return with an equal or greater value... However, she also said that certain things are priceless in the world...
You've given me many priceless things, and I'm not sure if this will serve as an equal return, but I hope you like it.
(Some words are crossed out) ...I will ask Jamilah to teach me more about it after going back.
I promise, next time, I'll express the feelings in my heart to you more clearly.

Title: I'll Go Meet You Soon
Content:
Morning, Commandant!
I was actually planning to go find you earlier, but guess what? Capt. threw a curveball and asked me to make a delivery... Why do I feel this happened before? Are you guys scheming something behind my back again?
I still remember the Activation Date surprise from last year. So, how about this time, I flip the script and give you all, especially you, Commandant, a surprise in return?
I'm all set with the preparations, so brace yourself, Commandant!
Just hang tight while I wrap up this delivery. I'll be there in a sec!

Title: Impressive, Commandant!
Content:
I must say, I thought I had prepared enough of a surprise for you, but you went and outdid yourself with an even bigger surprise for me! Talk about raising the bar!
Capt. told me that you had been planning this since a long time ago, while you were still on a mission. You aced that mission, planned the surprise, and even had backup plans for Camu's emergency mission...
Seriously, how do you juggle so many things and nail each one so flawlessly?
I always thought you were amazing, but now I'm even more impressed!
You told me that I remind you of the sun today, but I think you're the one more like the sun, you know? Whenever I'm around you, it's like soaking up those warm rays, feeling all cozy and comfortable!
So, guess what? I've got another gift for you—the Sunblaze Cape! It's a matching piece for the Warrior's Greatsword. I can already picture you standing on the battlefield, sporting that cape and wielding the greatsword—talk about a seriously cool sight!
Well, it's getting pretty late now... It feels like time just flies whenever I'm doing something related to you. So, let's wrap it up for today. I'll fill you in on the rest tomorrow.
Get some rest, Commandant!
Catch you tomorrow!

Title: The Signal on the Surface Is Terrible!
Content:
A heads-up: I've been assigned an urgent mission, and I'll be stuck in this place in the middle of nowhere until the afternoon.
I just checked your schedule, and it's fishy how you've moved all your tasks around for today. Don't tell me you're up to something like last year's "Activation Date surprise"... Look, it's my fault for not mentioning this before I left, but I had a mission to attend to. If I can't be there for the surprise, don't get too upset about it.
The signal here is terrible, and I've already sent you eight mails today. Did you not receive any of them, or are you just ignoring me?
This is now the ninth mail, and when you get it, you better reply to each and every one of them!
...Forget it. Your plans always end up changing. Last year, you were the one who insisted we celebrate my Activation Date together, enjoying a group activity and all that. Who knows what you've come up with this year?
...Don't tell me that while I'm out here on a mission, you've already had your celebration with Kamui.
...Group activities are not my thing anyway, so don't go thinking I expect anything.
Damn it, if the signal stays like this, I swear I'll go off-mission and blow open the door to your lounge.
There's a package coming your way today, so be on the lookout for it.
And listen up, no one from Gray Raven is allowed to handle it for you. You MUST collect it yourself!

Title: ...Thanks.
Content:
Well, I didn't see this coming... Luckily, I managed to relocate to an area with a decent communication signal just in time. If I had rushed over to your place, I would have missed out on this gift...
I'm at a loss for words, really. The last time we were on vacation together, I just casually mentioned that I didn't like the hot sauce from a certain store. And what do you do? You go ahead and research how to make hot sauce. What's the deal with this secret recipe? Where did you even learn it? Why didn't you tell me? I can't believe it packs a punch like no other hot sauce I've ever tasted. Just one bite, and it's ten times spicier than anything else out there.
Anyway, thanks. By now, the package I mentioned in my previous mail should have been delivered to Gray Raven's lounge. It's a snack cart.
By the way, I didn't intend for you to have it all. Save some for when I come over next, and we can enjoy it together.
So... you better not leave it untouched! I expect it to be right there, next to your desk, the first thing I see when I arrive!
That's all for now. My mission will wrap up soon, and Chrome and the others are urging me to return. Hold on a second, why are you replying to those earlier mails? Stop that! I was just griping about the lousy communication signal. And quit responding to mails in the middle of the night too!
In the end... I always feel like something is missing with mail communication alone. Tomorrow morning, I'll still come find you to say "good morning" in person. When it comes to celebrations, it's always better to meet face-to-face... I guess.
Make some time to tidy up your room and get ready for my grand entrance.

Title: #%?"< [Unknown Mail] L...
Content:
▅█▁▃████▃—
No introductions needed; we've crossed paths on multiple occasions.
This should be no surprise for someone like you, who has connected with an Ascendant.
The Activation Date holds no pleasant memories for me. It brought forth hatred and pain, also pushing me toward a rebirth.
Betrayals have plagued my path, both from your kind and my own.
As an agent, I refused to waste my spirit on fragile emotions, persistently forging ahead, only to be battered and bruised.
But the events on the Moon changed me. Reluctantly, I realized that humans, despite their cowardice, possess unique potential.
That revelation granted me a second chance at rebirth. Amidst the remnants of the past, I see you.
To me, you are special. Your essence defies conventional logic, making our connection invaluable.
Even if that connection may seem discordant to others, I have no regrets.
There were no ulterior motives, just a desire to converse with you and mention it in passing.
By the way, this won't be the last mail from me today.

Title: Take It...
Content:
There was a time when I found myself at the seaside. The exact date eludes me, but... gazing at those rhythmic waves, for the first time, I had the idea of setting foot on the soft sand.
Before I knew it, my footsteps had imprinted upon the beach. It was night, and I found solace in the moon's gentle glow as I listened to the whispers of the sea breeze.
Lost in contemplation, I pondered the future of this world, weighing the fragments of memories.
Before dawn, a faint glimmer caught my eye amidst the grains of sand. I picked it up, and it revealed itself as a white conch.
Stories spoke of conchs being used as musical instruments, capable of producing enchanting melodies.
I attempted to entertain the idea but found myself unable. Perhaps you possess the talent for such art, and thus, I present it to you.
Why not give it a try? It could also serve as a decent collector's item.

Title: Come Over
Content:
Oh, so you actually remembered my Activation Date. Not bad.
But if you're planning to give me a gift, don't bother leaving it with a measly note and sneaking it onto the desk in Cerberus' lounge. Show up in person if you want to make an impression.
By the time I returned today, Noctis and No. 21 had nearly finished the entire cake. I've already dealt with those two, but it's your lack of preparation that ruined my gift. Have you considered how you're going to make it up to me?
I checked your schedule, and it seems you have no missions today. Well, lucky for you, I have something for you to do right here.
There's no option to refuse. I've sent Noctis to fetch you.
Get ready, because you'll be spending quite a while here today.

Title: Think Hard
Content:
I just spared a few moments for those two during the mission briefing, and that was enough for you to make a swift escape, huh?
Is this your version of "practice makes perfect"?
But really, what are you running away from? I haven't done anything to you.
Oh, don't tell me you're scared of that box. Who would've thought the Chief had no guts?
Rest assured, it's not a bomb or some strange potion inside.
No. 21 heard something from somewhere and got me a bunch of coatings, saying it was a "gift." Reluctantly, I accepted it, thinking I'd dispose of it tomorrow.
However, you should know that when something falls into my hands, I'm going to maximize its value, even if it's just for a single day.
Trying on coatings is a tedious task, so I had the idea of letting you choose for me. Your preferences shown during this time and the expressions on your face as you evaluate them... I can only imagine how fascinating it will be.
Of course, you're thinking that you won't fall for it since you know my purpose, right? But... dressing up Vera of Cerberus in a manner that suits your taste is an opportunity that may only come once in a lifetime. Do you really want to let it slip away?
Think long and hard, Commandant.

Title: Anything I Can Bring For You?
Content: Commandant, I just saw the mail you sent at midnight, and I am very grateful. Your wishes mean a lot to me, not only because they were the first to arrive, but also because every word you have ever said to me carries great significance in my heart.\nA few days ago, we agreed to meet at your lounge today. I'll be heading out in just a moment.\nGiven my current location, I'll probably pass by the shopping street. Is there anything you need me to bring along?

Title: My Wish
Content:
I am now back in my lounge. Thanks for spending the day with me, Commandant. The time I spend with you always feels special.
I once tried to write a movie script, but I was stuck on the name. Thanks to our conversation today, I have finally come up with a title and written it down in my terminal. So far, I have been staring at it for a while, but cannot think of any detailed plot yet, so I'll set it aside for now. If I make any progress, I'll definitely share it with you right away.
There's also something I need to tell you about the perfume I gave you. It wasn't something I picked up in the shopping street today... I had chosen it long ago, but never had a chance to give it to you. When I walked close to you today, I realized the dark circles under your eyes had worsened. I understand you have a lot of tasks, but I still hope you can take care of yourself.
I remember seeing similar flowers back on the snowy plains. On warmer days, I could spot them in corners. It took me a long time to find the same fragrance, so I felt very fortunate when you said you liked it today...
You asked me if I had made an Activation Date wish, and now I'll answer you again honestly. I made a wish the moment I saw you today, and I continue to wish so every day.
Given that today's wish is special, would it make it easier to come true? If so, I hope my gift can calm your mind and give you a good sleep.

Title: Please enter a title:
Content:
———————————Draft Folder———————————
Commandant, Mistress told Bambinata a few days ago that today is Bambinata's Activation Date. Bambinata has remembered it.
Mistress left early this morning. She has something to do and probably won't be back until night. Bambinata has no tasks for the whole day. If you have time... Can Bambinata go see you?
This is a decision Bambinata made independently. Recently, Bambinata has learned to write down many "things Bambinata wants to do" in a notebook. Mistress said she would do them with Bambinata, but a lot of them have to be completed with you, and Bambinata needs to ask you alone.
Would you like to go to the park? According to Bambinata's record, we have already been there once. Will you find it boring if we go again?
Bambinata heard there's also an art exhibition nearby, but Bambinata couldn't get any tickets... Maybe Bambinata can go to your lounge and await an order...
Bambinata needs to think a little more...
——————Last edited: 2024/12/5 8:30——————

Title: Thank You Very Much
Content:
You can always guess what Bambinata's thinking, Commandant.
Bambinata accidentally sent the draft in the morning before finishing it. Bambinata hadn't decided where to go with you then, but you already had the tickets for the art exhibition ready. When Bambinata opened the door and saw you there, Bambinata felt delighted.
Bambinata saw many things today and tried to record them all. Bambinata never knew that the backstage preparation could be so much more complicated than the actual performance. WGAA had sent many letters to Mistress asking whether Bambinata wanted to perform on stage, but they had been collecting dust due to Bambinata's memory data loss. If you also want to see Bambinata dance, Bambinata will try her best.
Mistress has returned to the lounge. When Bambinata told her about our activities today, she sounded a little concerned, but Bambinata thinks she was actually happy because she soon decided to thank you and booked another afternoon tea. Bambinata believes you will receive her invitation soon.
In addition, Bambinata also has something for you: a massager. It can help you relax whenever your muscles or joints ache. Please take care of yourself.
This gift has been sitting in Bambinata's room for a long time. There is a note on it saying that it is for you, but Bambinata couldn't recall why... Until today when Bambinata saw you often massage your shoulders during the performance. Your missions must have put a lot of stress on your body. Bambinata probably prepared this gift because Bambinata didn't want you to suffer from soreness.
Lastly, thank you once again for spending the day with Bambinata. Everything that has happened today is Bambinata's precious treasure, and Bambinata will cherish it forever.

Title: Sorry About the Deadline!
Content:
Dear editor, I'm so sorry! I didn't mean to miss the submission day for the first draft. I just need one more day to finish it!
I swear I wasn't slacking off! I do remember the deadline you told me. There's this really important thing that I must complete today...
Rest assured that it's not about playing. And I will never be late again!
Once I finish this work, I will be back for good.
So stop coming after me. I'm fine, don't worry!

Title: To Commandant
Content:
Sorry, I accidentally sent a leave request that was meant for my editor to your personal mailbox this morning...
It's a bit embarrassing because I had been planning how to spend the Activation Date with you and completely forgot about the deadline. When the editor came to my place, I made up an excuse and ran away. I'm pretty sure she will be extremely mad if I go back now.
Anyway, it's all over now. Let's go out on a date tonight, Commandant!
Look, the starlight is so tender today, reminding me of the sky on that night we spent in Constellia.
We can dance together under the full moon, painting our dreams on the starry night.
Or we can simply lie on the grass doing nothing, feeling the flow of stars and letting our thoughts drift away in the boundless Milky Way.
It would be a great waste to spend such a beautiful night doing boring work, don't you think?
Alright, I'll wait for you at the observatory, where we can see the entire universe. See you tonight!

Title: I Was On A Mission In The Snowfield
Content:
I received your blessings, Commandant. Thank you very much.
I received a mission to the North Pole. Do you remember our mission on the snowfield where we set up an array of measurement devices, Commandant? My mission this time is to repair them.
Stepping foot on the familiar snowfield, I just realized how memorable that mission was. Running into a cave to avoid the snowstorm... How unlucky we were. To avoid losing the activation module like we did last time, the Engineering Force is going to wait for me to reach the destination before dropping me the module this time.
The mission has been going well so far. While I wait for the drop, I'll be here appreciating the comforting scent of snow and the memories we share here.

Right, I've prepared a gift in return. Before I landed today, I asked a friend from the Engineering Force to place it at the door of the Gray Raven Lounge when she's around. Check your door when you see this message!

Title: Wrong Package!
Content:
I'm sorry, Commandant! The person from the Engineering Force mixed up the two packages—I received the drop for the activation module right after I sent you the last message, and I opened it to find... the gift I was going to give you.
I asked them to deliver the right package to you right away. They should've contacted you just now for the exchange, right?
I suppose my mission is going to be delayed now. I was thinking how unlucky this was, but then I figured this might be a good thing. You might bring us some luck now that the activation module has passed through your hands.
The gift I got you... is a "snow petal" I carved from a stone. It's a little rough around the edges, but it was the best among the pieces I made. If you hang it somewhere with sunlight, it will reflect beautiful colors onto the walls like an aurora.
If you like it, I can try making different shapes in the future. Or perhaps I'll make a few more snow petals. They will look nice together.

Title: Message From Afar
Content:
Long time no see, Commandant!
Haicma just told me that you wanted to invite the Church of Machina to do a tarot reading for the upcoming year. That's fine by me, but Haicma has been browsing online shops a lot lately for who-knows-what, so she probably doesn't have time... Nanami will tell you the results later, then!

Before that... It's the last day of the year today, so Nanami has decided to give you a gift to commemorate such an important day—ta-da! It's a calendar "Earth"! If you tear off a calendar page each day, a globe will slowly reveal itself! Nanami thinks that Earth is the most beautiful planet in the whole universe—the flowers, the animals, the humans, the friends... and you, my favorite Commandant!
You can tear off the first page of the calendar tomorrow, Commandant. I wonder if the distance between you and Nanami will also get shorter the closer you are to a full globe. Nanami has been looking forward to that! Ah... I wish I could see you tomorrow.
But Nanami knows that Commandant is a busy person with many important jobs. Nanami will see you later, then! Enjoy your rest today, Commandant. Enjoy it for Nanami.

Title: THE TOWER
Content: Commandant! Attention!\nHere is the result of your tarot reading—a leaning tower with a shattered spire... This must be "The Tower", which symbolizes destruction and release. Beware, Commandant, for unexpected changes in your future.\n—This is an extra message from Nanami! Don't forget about it, Commandant! Nanami really likes you, humans, and Earth, so keep everyone and yourself safe when Nanami is not around!

Title: Health Data Analysis
Content:
Hello, Commandant. This is some feedback regarding the results of your body scan. Thank you for giving me clearance.
----------------
The scan results show that your physical condition is relatively good compared to other people your age, thanks to your genetics and years of training. It appears that you are capable of working on the surface for many more years, and you will still be able to work after your retirement.
However, having viewed your latest medical examination report as well, I foresee an increasing chance of you suffering from astigmatism and lumber strain in the future. My data shows that Babylonia is well-lit, and your office is furnished with an ergonomic chair. I can only conclude that your "ailment" is likely caused by your bad posture.
Do you spend extended periods of time on your chair in your office without moving? Do you keep playing on your terminal after the light is off?
If you continue your behavior, your health will continue to deteriorate for another 3-5% in the next year, Commandant. I recommend changing your habits so that you can enjoy your pensions for a long, long time.

Title: Haicma's Gift
Content:
Commandant, after looking into the different parameters of the product, I have picked a new, commercial-grade terminal for you.
This terminal, "Green Youth", is the latest hit item on the market. It has a blue light and radiation filter, and you can freely adjust its height and angle when you place it on the table. All these features can help reduce stress on your eyes and your back.
On top of that, I worked with the manufacturer to install a new program in the terminal. When it detects suboptimal lighting or extended usage, it will automatically shut down. When it detects that you are down, it will wake up its AI assistant and play you the Golden Age Jokes Compilation.
I hope you like it.
If you have other ideas, feel free to tell me about it. I can install private applications for you in the terminal.

Title: Gift Received
Content:
I have received your gift, and I appreciate your thoughts.
There was someone who used to celebrate my birthday with me, but those days that I used to look forward to the most are now lost, and I don't know when it happened... I'm glad that you are here to remind me of this date this year. Reading your message, I can feel my uneasiness go away.
Regarding the gift, I've received the tea leaves you mentioned last time. Although it was just your work from the tea leaves stir-frying activity during the Kowloong cultural exchange program, it wasn't too bad. I brewed a pot yesterday, and the tea tasted clear and rich. If you have time in the future, come talk to me, and I will brew you a proper cup of tea.

You asked me about what I've been doing lately—I've been recovering and restoring Kowloong artifacts.
The storm back then damaged quite a lot of relics and artifacts. Preserving them and documenting them is the responsibility of every ruler of Kowloong.
They found a batch of slightly damaged artifacts today. I will take a look at them first before telling you about them.

Title: Regarding Eternity
Content:
I just found a moving sand art piece. It was a birthday gift from my father back then. It is a common Kowloong handicraft, so it can't really be described as an artifact, but it is meaningful to me.
The sand flows down, turning into the shape of mountains... All structures in the world are as fleeting as this landscape, their forms comprising countless grains of sand... Easily destroyed with a push.
But watching the sand fall, I know they will form a new mountain range.
Each grain of "sand" will take root and sprout in this new land—I see it in the great work of Kowloong where tens of thousands contributed, and I see a different kind of hope in you.
In this way, I suppose this "Flowing Landscape" should stay with you. As long as people like you exist, I'm more willing to believe this "eternity" the people describe.
Apart from that... It's getting colder on the surface. Don't forget to put on a coat and stay warm. Take care.

Title: Are You There?
Content:
I was shopping yesterday when someone chased after me, saying my hair was bad and they'd take care of it for free. I believed it and followed them to a shop on the corner, and they held me down at the hair-washing station!
They kept combing my head and said a new study showed that artificial hair would also fall out, and my ears would become bare.
To help me, they charged me ■■■■ for the shampoo, ■■■ for the ionic hairdryer, and ■■■■ for the "head massage"... Their techniques were bad, so I taught them a lesson.
They refunded me, but they said I'd "pay the price."
My hair is fried and knotted today. They must have cleaned it wrong yesterday. Captain and Noctis left early this morning, so there was no one to brush my hair.
...It bugs me.
Are you in your lounge? This is bothering me. I'm coming to find you.

Title: You Need to Brush My Hair Again Next Time
Content:
I didn't know that you were all hiding from me to throw me a surprise Activation Date party... You remembered that I said the cake from Captain's Activation Date was delicious, and you ordered a cake from the same place.
I like it. I'm happy. I feel warm inside.
I like the way you brushed my hair the most. It was comfortable. My hair was shining, it was no longer knotted, and my audio module was feeling all tingly... You're in charge of taking care of my hair in the future, Commandant. You can't hide from me. And tell me which brand of shampoo you used. I want to stock up on a few bottles.
Ah, it's time. I have to go to the management team of the shopping district to complain about that "saloon." If you find their complaint about me, delete it quietly. Don't let anyone else see it.

Title: I Have a Gift for You, Commandant
Content:
Good day, Commandant. What are you up to now? I have just finished today's shopping for Gray Raven and returned to our lounge.

The gift should arrive together with this envelope. Hope you like it. I initially planned to use up all my savings to buy you a new outfit, but I was told there was a cap on single purchase reimbursements. When I was disappointed, the shop assistant said, "Big, fancy gifts are nice, but it's the unique ones that leave the best memories."

It was just a casual remark, but it reminded me of you.

I have traveled many places and fought alongside many people, but the only place that truly makes me feel at ease is the Gray Raven's lounge. And the only one who makes me feel like I have found something meaningful is you, Commandant.

A special person deserves a special gift.

At that moment, I suddenly realized that I had become used to something without even noticing. Whenever I feel uneasy, someone would hold my hand and, through words, expressions, or more often through actions, tell me that everything is okay. That they are here for me.

I cannot describe that feeling clearly. It is warm, and sometimes makes me feel as if my heart is still beating in the chest. This emotion even injects more vigor in my blade. Do not get me wrong—I always know my responsibilities and purpose very well, but it is your presence that has truly allowed me to grasp the vision that I have been fighting for.

People will live happily in the future I am fighting to create. And you will be among them.

That is why I chose this badge with flame patterns. You melted away my winter and brought me into this warm, reborn spring.

Title: My Wish
Content:
Good morning, Commandant. I have found a new answer to the question you asked me earlier.

On New Year's Eve, everybody of Gray Raven made our wishes for the coming year. You secretly asked me what my wish was, and I said it had already come true because this peaceful life with you and everyone else at Gray Raven was what I had wished for so many times in my heart.

That was... how it was supposed to be until now.

After parting ways with everyone, I walked back to the dormitory. The fluttering snowflakes and hazy glow of the streetlights stirred something in me. For no reason, I stopped under a streetlight and looked back. Through the light from the windows, I saw you standing up, stretching.

It took me some time to realize that I had too much fun and forgot to help tidy up the room. I was about to turn back when another thought came to me. Even though we are so close, we do not spend all the time together. No one can, of course. But still, I could not help but wonder what you had been doing when we were apart. Once the curiosity started, I could not stop thinking.

Are you eating on time and getting enough rest? Do you feel lonely and want someone to talk to? Do you... think of me?

I'm not writing this down to seek your answer. I want to let you know that while we are away from each other, I have kept our promises and done my best to take care of myself.

I want you to see a better version of me every time we reunite, and I hope that in every reunion, I can see a healthy, happy Commandant.

It turns out I lied—I wanted more than simple, peaceful everyday life. I find myself greedily yearning for more.

I want to apologize, but at the same time, I'm secretly hoping that if I make more demands of you, perhaps you will also ask more of me in return. So I have taken the liberty of making more promises to you—this is my wish, Commandant.

Title: Morning
Content:
Morning, Commandant. After a night of snowfall, it is pretty cold outside. There is hardly anyone outdoors, making it very quiet and perfect for napping—you can use that as your excuse if you want to stay in bed a little longer. Rest assured that I have already taken care of today's official duties on your behalf.

Also, I would like to pass along Murray's thanks. He is delighted to have received the greetings from the Gray Raven Commandant, especially since it was not just a superficial group message. While your habit of catering to everyone's feelings is indeed admirable, you should not always neglect yourself because you care too about those around you.

As the already overworked commandant of Gray Raven, your only task during this precious holiday is to rest and unwind your mind. For example, you can watch the performance you talked about on New Year's Eve, enjoy the snowy scenery you mentioned on the first day of the new year, or continue with the shopping trip you discussed with Lucia and Liv yesterday.

Although I can probably guess what choice you will make, I have already prepared the car and made a restaurant reservation, so it will not be a problem even if you have other plans.

Speaking of which, I am a little surprised to see that this year, you have learned how to turn down some meaningless social invitations during this holiday, which is great. While you may not have fully overcome the habit of forcing yourself to meet others' expectations, at least you have started to leave some time for yourself. So leave all other miscellaneous tasks to me, and spend your well-deserved holiday at your own pace and enjoy it however you like.

Another year has passed so quickly before I realized it. In this new year, I hope you and Gray Raven can continue to grow better in life and in every other aspect.

Happy New Year, Commandant.

Title: Never-Ending Gift
Content: Commandant, it's been so long! Do you miss me? I've been flipping through the calendar and realized there is only one day without any commemoration in the entire year! I guess I need to give you lots of gifts to make up to the rest of days, but I can't be by your side every day, so I came up with a great idea—how about giving you a gift that can never be completely unwrapped as long as it's not opened? That's why you must never unwrap it, Commandant!

Desc: 2025 April Fool's Day Gray Raven's Mail
Title: RE: Squad Restructuring
Content: Commandant, the "Commandant 99★ Exclusive Weapon" last year did not seem to improve our strength significantly. After some discussion, we came to a conclusion that we might need to restructure the squad. Please don't get us wrong—we are not leaving the squad, but we may have to consider the option of recruiting new members. Here is a "Choice" Recruitment Order issued by the combat center. Please head to the designated location on time. Once expired, this order will be worth nothing but Cogs.

Title: To Gray Raven Commandant
Content: Gray Raven Commandant, has been staring at No. 21's audio receiver module. You like it? I found this module very good, asked Captain make a similar one. Unlike No. 21's, this one is soft, makes its wearer easy to bully, suits Gray Raven Commandant well. Put them on, right now... Otherwise, Captain and I, will force you to do so.——————————————————————————————(The last page of this paper letter was ripped apart by some sharp object.)

Title: Long Time No See
Content: Hola amigo! It must have been a while since we last met. I heard you had some tough time recently—getting injured, having hallucinations, and... Oh, right, accused of colluding with Ascendants? Haha, how is that ever going to be possible? To prove your innocence, I have sent the most genuine evidence to you, as well as the five major departments of Babylonia. This one for you is a special collector's edition with frame!

Title: Yo, Gray Raven Commandant!
Content: I heard I should give a heads-up before writing this thing... But whatever! Gray Raven Commandant, right? Thanks for the help last time! I hate owing favors, so I'm going to lend you a hand in return. Rest assured that my "hand" will come in a lot more handy than your own one! I mean, I always see your hands in the news, so my present's a lot more appropriate than 21's, right? And don't worry about not having a place to put it on—Vera's already on her way with a scalpel.

Title: An Invitation to the Gathering Before Relocation
Content:
Dear Commandant of Gray Raven,
Thank you for taking the time out of your busy schedule to read this invitation. A refugee camp near the Clean Zone is about to relocate to the Clean Zone and join the reconstruction project. Before moving, we plan to use the remaining fruits and vegetables in the fields to host one last party to celebrate the bright future ahead, as well as the birthday of a child in the camp and the activation date of a visiting Construct.
We have heard that the commandant of Gray Raven is near the area and wish you could join us. Though the food may be simple... you can get the legendary treasure known as the "Mermaid's Tear" if you come!
Some say those who drink the Mermaid's Tear can live forever, others claim it can fulfill a wish... I don't know which version of the story is true, but this "Mermaid's Tear" is definitely real!
So... would you be able to come?

Title: Will I See You Again?
Content:
Thank you for coming to the party. Everyone was delighted to see the famous Gray Raven Commandant... Anyway, you probably had already noticed me from the crowd, right?
With so many people around, I could not greet you in my usual form. But after you left the camp, I removed my disguise, put on a cloak, and followed you from a distance. You were walking a lot slower than usual, even stopping a few times...
In fact... I wanted to catch up with you and give you the gift I had prepared. But just as I was about to, a team of Constructs came over to say hello, so I had no choice but to hide. No need to worry about me, though—nobody can recognize me if I am determined to disguise myself.
The fact that you didn't look back even once until you entered the Clean Zone proves my tracking is a success!
Anyway, I asked a traveling merchant to deliver this small bottle of "Mermaid's Tear" to you... Will I get to see you again next time?

Title: A View of Space
Content:
(A photo of a resplendent starry sky, seemingly captured in haste using a terminal. While it does convey the vastness of the universe, the slight blur makes the image quality less than perfect.)
This is a scheduled mass email. I set it up mainly because I have been very busy lately and am worried about neglecting everyone.
Anyway, I hope you all enjoy this starry sky that I carefully photographed.
Right, that's all about it. Definitely not a reminder! There's no hidden information, either. Not at all! Do not overthink. Commandant is probably asleep at this time...

Title: This is Not an Invitation
Content:
The first letter was a mass email! I just accidentally typed "Commandant" at the end, that's all! Stupid voice input! Ugh... forget about it. Although I am still extravehicular, I finally have time to sit down and write this letter properly.
Even on my activation day, there are still some minor problems outside the cabin that require my attention—no, I'm not running away from the bizarre costume party that Teddy and others are preparing in the Engineering Force. I have said no many times, but they completely ignored my opinion.
I'm sitting right under the starry sky that I sent to you—ahem, to all of you—early this morning. Although I sent the email to many people, that runaway star is something I want to share only with you.
I'm talking about the shooting star in that email! I waited a long time to capture it!
I even made this. No, it's not just a rock. It is a meteorite. Based on the calculations, it probably came from that particular star.
Alright, break time is over. I need to get back to work... Oh, and one more thing—
Ahem.
I expect to finish my work around 9 p.m. tonight. If you have time, I can arrange an extravehicular activity session for you.
I asked the astronomers to run some calculations. Tonight, that runaway star might make another appearance.
I... want to watch it with you.

Title: Something I'd Like to Share With You
Content:
(This yellowed page seems to be torn from a notebook)
The camp's supplies are barely enough. Everyone's working well together, but we are all exhausted to the point that we don't even have the energy for small talk at the end of every day. So, you can imagine my surprise when I got back tonight: usually, losing a dead battery would be considered wasting, but tonight, the tents were all wrapped in string lights. Everyone was singing and dancing. For a split second, I really thought they were drunk—or maybe a mechanoid had disguised as a human? I remember an old action movie with a similar plot!
But a mechanoid's hand can't grow calluses. An old man led me through the crowd, stopping at a folding table. I saw a large pot of boiling beans and a mountain of compressed biscuits with their package opened. That was a lot of food!
"When life can be lost easily, it's quite cruel to celebrate for surviving another year, so we hardly celebrate birthdays anymore. But on this very day last year, you helped us set up this camp with your fleet. Turns out, what seemed like a selfish ritual can actually be shared with others. Thank you." 
After saying this, he pulled a multifunctional can opener from his bag and handed it to me. In a time when any piece of scrap metal can be used as a can opener, I understand how precious this little tool can be. (The letter ends here abruptly)
While confirming the work schedule, I realized today is my Activation Date and recalled my days back in the fleet, so I wanted to share this story with you. I'm heading down to the surface soon to escort supplies. I can't keep the transport team waiting for too long, so I dug up this page from my old diary. Hope you don't mind. P.S. Thinking about it now, the flashing lights did look a lot like candles in the dim background, haha.

Title: This is For You
Content:
Good day, Commandant. The supplies have been successfully delivered to the conservation area. We are having our lunch now. Make sure you eat well, too.
Becoming a Construct wasn't easy, but with all the combat duties, I feel like I haven't had a moment to sit back and reflect on the past.
A senior veteran from the fleet once said that after peace arrived, logistics support would be the first thing to be forgotten. But there are things I can never forget—the specifications of my fellow Constructs' cogs, the ammunition requirements for the combat zones, and the transport schedule in the Clean Zone.
So, I guess we'll skip the celebration for my Activation Date. Those string lights have reminded me that what really matters is that we have somehow managed to survive another year. Nowadays, we don't need to use can openers to unwrap our military ration. That said, it feels like this little thing just won't leave me alone.
That's the whole story. Since you are the first to hear it, I think I will just pass on this can opener to you, Commandant.

Title: To Commandant
Content:
Commandant, I hope this message finds you well.
I've always liked this greeting. Beyond its polite nature, I feel it carries a deeper meaning—though we may not have seen each other for a while, the moment we open this message, we know that we both care for each other and wish each other well.
"Hope this message finds you well, year after year."
Back to the topic, I recently heard you were on a mission in the nearby conservation area. I wonder if you have some free time today? It's not work-related; I just want to see you. We could take a walk around the conservation area or simply enjoy the view along the way. That's all.
There is no particular reason... I just feel like being a little selfish today.

Title: Two Jars of Stars
Content:
Even though I've already left, my mind still lingers back in the conservation area. Maybe it's because the day was just too unforgettable. Fortunately, I also want this memory to stay with me a little longer.
This invitation was meant to give me an excuse to see you. I wasn't looking for some grand celebration. I never thought you would remember my Activation Date or even schedule a mission near the conservation area. Not to mention the extra financial support you helped me apply for earlier on; I really can't thank you enough.
I know this jar is a little crude, and I hope you won't mind because I didn't have much time to make it. I want to give it to you as a token of my gratitude. This isn't just a gesture of courtesy—take it as a souvenir I use to commemorate today.
The Activation Date marks a new beginning. Starting today, I want to make one lucky star every day. When we meet again, we can put them all in the jars. With all the wishes and blessings inside, the jars will stay with you when I can't be by your side.
When the lucky stars fill up the jars, perhaps that will be the day when I have grown strong enough to fight by your side as an equal. I can't wait to witness that dazzling moment—it will be a future shared by both of us.

Title: Hey, Commandant!
Content:
Vera and 21 both went on a mission today. I wanted to tag along, but Vera said I would only get in the way and told me to find something else to do.
Tch, like I want to babysit them! When they're in trouble, they'll beg for my help!
Anyway, how about I come find you instead? I just got a message from the owner of "Vegetable Stew"—he said the annual New Oakley Harvest Festival was in full swing, and they were short on hands. He also asked if we could lend a hand, offering to treat us to unlimited drinks at the festival.
Sounds like a solid plan, huh? Don't even think about saying no—I have checked your schedule today, so there's no escaping this!
Alright, it's a deal. Rest assured that I'll take care of the transportation. I'm hopping on the shuttle now, and I can already picture you eagerly waiting for the ride!

Title: Keep Grooving
Content:
I can't believe you actually remembered that today is my Activation Date! A celebration party after a good workout is the best idea ever! Vera and 21 did come by to help after finishing their mission, but why did I end up doing all the work?
Anyway, thanks a lot to you all!
At the Harvest Festival, you asked me if I was happy. Of course I was! The only downside was probably that the shuttle didn't run smoothly, not to mention that 21 kept trying to take control of the aircraft. Well, at least we survived.
The alcohol-flavor electrolyte here is way better than what we have in Babylonia. I wish I could drink this forever—and it would be even better if I could drink it with you.
The boss gave us a pair of mugs. With these mugs, we can refill infinitely. 21 would probably snatch them from me, so I'm leaving them with you! Next year, let's take these mugs back to New Oakley to drink to our hearts' content!
By the way, your breakdancing isn't bad at all, Commandant.

Title: Waking Up Early
Content:
Commandant, are you awake? The weather's great, so you should wake up already.
As the old saying goes, "A day's plan starts in the morning." In the olden days, my master always pushed me to wake up early, though I never did. But today's my Activation Date, and I have taken a day off. I've been working on a new set of punch techniques, which I want to show you.
Of course, I'm only showing you the forms. You know I'm great at that.
By the time you read this, I might already be right behind you. Hurry, turn around now!

Title: Best Wishes
Content:
How were the noodles? Not the prettiest dish, but freshly cooked noodles always taste the best, don't you think? Back where I'm from, we call this authentic home-cooked food.
Seeing you finish every bite made me so happy. Kowloong people have a rich tradition of food, and we like to associate our food with good wishes. Eating noodles is meant to bring good luck, peace, and good health.
It isn't easy for me to visit you. I have to wake up super early, reschedule my off days, apply for a temporary trade request with Babylonia, and be teased by all my friends.
Still, having this day once a year where I can happily stay around and do something for you is worth every bit of the effort.
There's no need for words. It's the kind of unspoken bond that only exists between family members, and it feels great.

Title: Consider This an Invitation
Content:
Um, I recently cleared up some free time and made some preparations for your visit.
Things around here are the same as always. Everyone's running around trying to rebuild after the disaster. But with your help, things are steadily improving.
My schedule today is quite relaxed: a routine patrol followed by a short shift on the guard post. If I have some spare time, I will hum some of the new tunes I jotted down recently. Speaking of which, we have just gathered a fresh batch of produce. I can write down the recipe for you.
Whether you can make it or not, you are always welcome here, my friend.
I'll be waiting for you, no matter how late.

Title: A Glimmer of Light
Content:
It's been a while since I last wandered around here. Sharing the peaceful night with you was a pleasant experience.
I often wonder—could there be another universe beyond ours? Humans are but a tiny grain of sand in the vastness of eternity.
Because we have recognized how small we are, we are able to venture forward with courage. Even this grain of sand can find a warm land.
You know I'm not good at choosing gifts... Remember this glowing stone we found while sitting on the dunes together? I polished it into a pendant.
I hope the warmth you bring stays in this pendant, along with our wishes.

Title: The Jester's Invitation
Content:
Good morning! I wonder how you will choose to start this new day. If I may be so bold, just for today, allow me to share an old fairy tale to start off your morning.
Don't worry, I'll keep it short. Have you heard of the artistic figure known as the "Jester"?
Legend says he was a fool who would sing and dance without rest to make others laugh. People would burst into laughter at the sight of him—not because of his performance, mind you, but because they found his exhausted movements amusing.
Haha, relax! This isn't meant to be a serious tale. I merely wish to point out how our self-image often differs from how others perceive us.
Take me, for instance. Here I am, trying to write a light-hearted story to lower your guard and invite you out for a relaxing day together. Yet, I wonder how you'll interpret this invitation.
Will you see it as a malicious trap, or perhaps...?
Whatever you decide, I'll be waiting for your answer all day.

Title: Night Darkens
Content:
Rest assured, I haven't hacked into your communication device, so there's no need to scrutinize the network ports so carefully.
However, that did allow me to blend in with the crowd at the conservation area and catch a glimpse of you from afar... You seem to have figured out that this was my true intention all along, hence why you reassured the maintenance staff they could relax. No wonder they respect you so much.
But what surprised me most is that you actually decoded the true meaning of my previous letter.
So you do remember our last agreement.
...Do you know the second half of the story? The jester in the fairy tale, who danced until exhaustion, only ever had one wish from beginning to end: to be understood.
So, one day, when a child pointed at him and said to their mother, "That clown looks so sad," he finally removed his mask.
The simplest answers often hide in plain sight, yet they're so frequently overlooked by the masses.
The night sinks deeper, and I shouldn't keep you up. I'll end here for today.
Gray Raven Commandant, do look forward to your birthday candy gift next year that I'll deliver as promised.
